title: Windows Me
summary: Windows Millennium Edition, or Windows Me (marketed with the pronunciation of the pronoun "me"),[5] is an operating system developed by Microsoft as part of its Windows 9x family of Microsoft Windows operating systems. It is the successor to Windows 98, and was released to manufacturing on June 19, 2000, and then to retail on September 14, 2000. It was Microsoft's main operating system for home users until the introduction of its successor Windows XP in 2001.[6]
